Reviews.Title: “good price for the service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: samyeguiluz
Reviews.Content: The owner is a very nice German guy who lives in Mexico. Er spricht gut Spanisch auch. El hotel es agradable, muy limpio y tiene todas las comodidades básicas.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep until 5:30am at this place.”
Reviews.Author: Knows
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this used to be a nice little place. Very quaint, nothing fancy and a good location....before the clubs moved in. There are literally six open air bar/clubs beginning two doors down. They blast the music so loud, each trying to outdo the other, the windows in our room vibrated. My mistake, as I didn't check tripadvisor before securing a room here. We left after only two nights. Just couldn't take it and will never return. Don't be fooled into thinking the rooms off the road are more quiet. The music seems to echo and travel around the courtyard of this place. It's ruined this place, unless you like staying up until 5:30am, which is when the music and noise stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Baite-and-Switch "Sleeping in a Disco" I should have read TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: drgeb
Reviews.Content: Well part of it was my own fault not reading TripAdvisor! The title "Sleeping in a Disco" is right on. I arrived at midnight and all clubs were already in full swing. These clubs are right down the street and are one of the few ones opened till 4am. Immediately when I got here I was welcomed warm heartedly and told that noise would not be an issue they have double paned widows and then provided with ear plugs and instructed on how to use these. What brought me to the place was the location and also the style of the room, the Robinson Crusoe look. Well I got a different room a much bigger one but not want I had initially in mind. Another thing was the price, I was told that there is an extra 6% charge if I use my credit card. This was not indicated properly on the site, only if I pay cash will I not have this issue. The room was nice, staff very friendly, but if I had read TripAdvisor I would have picked up not only the noise issue each and every night of my 7 day stay but also the other complaints made about the sheets and mattress. In addition the bathroom sink had severe issues where the faucet was shorter then the basin making water leak all over the counter and difficult to place your hands under the faucet to get access to water. I am totally not happy with the place. When one goes on vacation you expect that what you pay for is clearly stated, any pictures that show the room your are booking is exactly or closely follow with what you choose up front and and that any extra charges or fees are clearly indicated. If this is not the case and they can not meet this then the hotel should let you know up front so you can make the right decisions up front and not have to deal with them on the spot during ones stay. Well it is what it is! I will definitely come back to Playa but their won't be an eclipse in mind! :)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint but not quiet”
Reviews.Author: vacationsrforus
Reviews.Content: I must start out by saying the staff were wonderful and very kind. My husband and I were looking for a quiet serene place for this vacation, and although the court yard is lush it is not so quiet. If we were into the night life scene it would be perfect as there were 3 discos nearby. We had booked to stay for 15 nights but only stayed one as unfortunately we were placed on the ground floor which faced into the small court yard and everyone entering stared in our room, so we needed to leave the drapes closed, this left the room dark. No other rooms were available due to the Easter weekend. Since we are a middle aged couple who were looking for tranquility this was not the place for us as the discos can be heard till the wee hours of the night. If we were younger and wanting to enjoy the loud music and dancing you canot beat this location. The beach club is a fair walk away as well but there are so many places to rent a chair this is not really an issue. Our world traveller daughter would have loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start???”
Reviews.Author: SunKisstManitoba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel online. We looked at the website, and it looked and sounded like a great place to stay with the Mexican charm we were looking for. My lesson was this: Do not judge a hotel by the website. The website says this: "The Eclipse Hotel is located in Playa del Carmen's most privileged location, in the very heart of town, on First Avenue, between the beach and Fifth Avenue (close to the action, yet secluded enough to guarantee you a good night's sleep)." Unless you like to go to sleep after 4 or 5 AM, you are not getting a good nights sleep. There are 4 very happening bars located literally 50 steps from the hotel that play loud music from about 10 pm until 4 am. And the mattresses are very hard and uncomfortable. Also, we found the website to be very misleading....there is NO snorkel equipment for guests to use...there is no Deli Shop to eat at....24 hour security service?? Not so much....we arrived to a dark hotel that even though we gave them our credit card information and had a confirmation for our 10 NIGHT stay, there was no one around to contact...there is a phone #...but we did not bring out cell phones as we are from Canada going to Mexico for a vacation....not a business trip. After the friendly girl in the shop next door tried to help us out and after almost an hour....We ended up having to stay in a dingy little hotel room with no hot water...across the street for the night. (not the most enjoyable thing after a FULL day of flying with 2 kids and 4 suitcases to lug around) There is no place to get a massage........the terrace that is pictured on the website photos looks NOTHING like the photos. It is unused and un kept. I even got to sneak a peak at the rooftop jacuzzi tub that looks like it hasn't been used in about 12 months. The safe in the rooms are there, yes, but at a charge of $2.00 USD per day. The barbecue area....um....well we didn't cook any food on it....lets just leave it at that. Not sure what kind of room service they offer, seeing as there is no place to eat other than the continental breakfast they offer ar $5.00 USD per person per day, which we did find sufficient. Fruit, toast, cereal, coffee, tea, juice, and some pastries. It was good. And the lady that serves it every morning, not too sure of her name....well, she was sweet. There is no Bar and Restaurant. So dont believe that either. As for the beach club facility access...not sure where that is...nor was it mentioned to us upon arrival or at anytime during our stay. There is internet, but it does have a cost of a minimum of 10 pesos. Even for hotel guests. So, from our point of view, we do NOT recommend this hotel. It has a lot of false advertising on it;s website, and pamphlets, and unless you are going to be out partying all night long every night....this is not the place for you. Which is unfortunate, as it is close to the beach (but there are lots of others) and the room itself was nice. It was clean and the bathroom was good.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good service and clean rooms...not for light sleepers.”
Reviews.Author: tripsfromaustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights and really liked this hotel itself. The room was huge, very clean and a great rate, $90 night. We had a balcony, as well as access to the jungle courtyard. The only complaint is the noise from the clubs a block away made it very difficult to sleep. If you're a light to medium sleeper, I would suggest finding a place further away from the clubs (Blue Parrot, etc.) Well, to be honest...I'm not sure which was worse, the women next door loudly complaining about the noise all night or the music itself. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: IvarsLV
Reviews.Content: Our trip was 7 days long, around Yucatan. We stay at Eclipse for our first night, and it was very good night! After some days visiting Merida, Tulum, etc, we return to Eclipse, because it was the best place where we stay for all trip. Guys from reception Alehandro and Pedro are very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in a disco.”
Reviews.Author: andymanca
Reviews.Content: The noise, starting at about 10 pm and escalated til about 4 am, most evenings I would imagine, ( I was there for two nights in the early week). This is now a mexican disco district, with lots of deep thumping riffs etc. etc. Go for it if this is your cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Service yes, hotel no”
Reviews.Author: rbandy1
Reviews.Content: Great help from the office personnel except for the thief and liar Pedro Sanchez. The room lacks quality (musty smell and bugs) but the staff was friendly and tried to make the stay a good one. AC works but blows directly on the bed. Kitchenette??? Nope, not even close. I will pay for the upgrade to a better hotel next time. Too much noise from the clubs around the cornor until 3:00 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: aliandgreg
Reviews.Content: Small quiet hotel in the perfect spot. Close to 5th Avenue but once the air conditioning was on we couldn't hear a thing. These suites were spotless, the housekeeping is great. If you are looking for a place with character and not a boring hotel this is definately it. The staff are very friendly, and the cafe beside the hotel is great and the prices were very good. There is a little pottery shop just up the block with some fantastic stuff. The hotel is very central to everything, if you are looking to save money, Walmart is not far and you have a little kitchen in your unit, beers are cheap at the little store beside the eclipse. Thank you to everyone at the Eclipse and the Cafe for making our visit to Mexico so fantastic. We will see you again! If you are a diver there are 3 outfits within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It great location”
Reviews.Author: artful99
Reviews.Content: My son & I just returned from sending a week in Playa. After resreaching small hotels in Playa I settled on The Eclipse. I did not make a reservation just walked in. The staff is friendly and very helpful, the rooms were cleaned daily, the beds were comfortable and there was plently of hot water. Coffee and filtered water were availalbe in the court yard and breakfast coupons were availble upon request. The place is beautiful and charming and I throughly enjoyed my staff. The gate locks at 11:00pm and security staff are present so if you have a late check in you would have to make arrangements. Can't wait to go back. My only complaint was the noise from the clubs on Friday night, but with the windows closed and AC on this seems to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Nice Place, Nice personnel”
Reviews.Author: Kilster
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 days with my girlfriend in a Robinson Crusoe "suite". It's a small room with 2 floors, you can see more on their website. The place was clean, nice with lot of vegetation and places to relax, quiet and very close to all the tourism spots (One street south of 5th Avenue). It has wireless internet included so I could check my emails in the morning before going out. that was a huge plus. Included breakfest was to a restaurant near by on 5th called Tequila Barriles. The breakfast was very good. My room also included 1 Palapa and 2 chairs at the beach club "Playa Mamitas". Would definably recommend for young or middle age couples without kids or groups of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: glenandlori
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean and excellent location. On our first night our plane was delayed so we got to the hotel at 1 in the morning, it was locked up tight. We asked the security to get the manager (Matias) which he did try but Matias said he was not getting up and come back tomorrow!!! and we had reservations!!! So now here we are at 2:30 am wandering 5th Ave wondering what to do. Wew eventually found a place on 10th for the rest of the night. When we went back the following day Matias apologized and booked up in. Once in the room the fridge did not work, the toilet did not flush, it had a musty smell to it and also no hot water for 2 days. Matias was not very helpful as he said he had way to much to do. He then asked if we could pay our bill early, apparently they needed money for repairs. The free breakfast at the Hole In The Wall was good but He ended up charging us 5 dollars a day for those breakfasts. When it was time to leave we asked for a shuttle to the airport, Matias said no problem $30 dollars, we paid him caught the shuttle, when we got to the airport the driver said that will $30 dollars, we tried to tell him inn our broken spanish that we already paid, well after 20 miinutes of this he let us go, This is a nice hotel, just a bad management..Never Again

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home if you're not doing all-inclusive!!”
Reviews.Author: johnny_tt
Reviews.Content: I loved this place!! It was truly a home away from home. The staff were very attentive to the few idosyncrocies that occurred during my nine day stay - nothing major though, and the biiggest issue was no hot water but it wasn't even for a full day and the maintenance folks were there to fix it. The rooftop deck and common areas were a real treat, as was having wireless internet throughout the hotel. I can't wait to go back!! I'm sure its even better now as they were adding some new rooms when I was there. Amazing location if you want to take in the town of Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Website is deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: babachi
Reviews.Content: The website for this hotel is COMPLETELY deceiving. We stayed in a "grand eclipse suite", which looked nothing like the photo. The room was very small, the toilet didn't flush, the sliding door on the balcony didn't lock, and the safe key was missing. We had read that breakfast was included, but we never saw it. On the evening we checked out, we were given the tickets for breakfast in a restaurant. We had already been there 3 days but were never given or informed about tickets and breakfast being off the premises. The hotel is very close to the shopping and restaurant area on 5th street, which is a plus, although you can hear the noise from the nearby disco, as the walls are very thin.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Pennylane155
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Hotel Eclipse in May 2007, when I planned my return trip in January 2008 there was nowhere else I considered staying. I arrived in January having reserved for 32 nights and was pleasantly surprised to have been given a room that was better then I expected as it also included a kitchen with table & chairs and also a small sofa. Having a choice of places to sit apart from the bed was very nice for my extended stay. I was able to settle into my room and did not have to change rooms at all during my stay. The hotel courtyard is beautiful and I enjoyed sitting on the roof deck in the evenings. The hammocks under the large palapa on the second floor were the perfect spot to relax on the few rainy afternoons. The hotel provides free drinking water and coffee available day & night and the breakfast at the Hole in the Wall next door was amazing. I made use of the beach club passes hassle free. The bed was comfortable, the shower hot with a new hot water tank having been installed at the beginning of my stay and the wireless internet was an added bonus. Mexico is Mexico and there are always little hiccups that could be perceived as inconveniences but I choose to look at those things as all part of the adventure. Sometimes the lights went out, sometimes the water was turned off, sometimes the internet was down, these experiences were few and far between, never lasted long and were always taken care of immediately with care and concern from the staff. These things even happen in my own home from time to time so I would never consider these to be a poor reflection of the service of this hotel. The staff at the hotel reallly make this place what it is. Matias checked me in and set the stage for what I found to be exceptional service from himself, from Pedro the receptionist and also from Peter the owner. I felt each of them worked hard to ensure my stay was the best it could be. When I needed help setting up my local cell phone, they took care of it. When I wanted to arrange a taxi to take me to Tulum for the day, they took care of it. When I needed my laundry picked up, they took care of it. When my friend arrived for a week they put him in the next room with an adjoining door between us. They directed me to the nearest gym that didn't charge and arm and a leg, when I wanted restaurant recomendations they had plenty, when I wanted food delivered they took care of it. When there was a problem with the air conditioning on a Sunday, they took care of it. When I left a note along with a few extra pesos asking Rosa the maid if she could iron an outfit for me it was beautifully laid out on the bed when I returned. I felt a sense of community at this hotel that I haven't found anywhere else in my travels. This is what makes this hotel gold to me and has guaranteed it is the only place I will stay on my return trips to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean place with terrible management”
Reviews.Author: NikMosy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Eclipse for a week in January 2008. When we arrived we met the "manager" Martinez who was still recovering from a New Years hangover (it was January 3rd). The courtyard to this place is beautiful. It is built kind of like a giant tree house. We stayed in one of the standard rooms with 2 beds. The rooms were very clean and continued to stay clean throughout the trip (always tip the housekeeper well). While the place was certainly not a luxury hotel, it was a great place to stay at an amazingly cheap price. We enjoyed going to the sun deck on top of the roof and playing cards in late afternoon. The beach is just a short walk from the hotel. I recommend turning left once you hit the beach and walk past the large pier because there are better waves there. Free breakfast at The Hole in the Wall was amazing! They served freshly squeezed orange juice and your choice of 5 different entrees. I recommend the potato and egg burrito with fresh salsa. Since the hotel is located centrally near 5th ave, one can walk from one end to the other of 5th and take a look at all the great restaurants. I am not too sure why the owner of the place would want someone like Martinez running his hotel because on more than one occasion I witnessed him being rude to guests or telling them that he didn't have time to deal with their simple requests. We asked him for some cups the one day and beach towels the other, and the response was always the same..."what do you need that for". It became an inside joke among us and the other guests throughout our stay. Overall I would strongly recommend this place if you are looking for clean, comfortable, cheap, and more relaxed place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My 2 cents worth”
Reviews.Author: sunnydazee
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night which was a Friday as we were moving into a condo on Saturday. I can only thank God it was for one night. I had been in contact with Matias the manager, for at least 4 months when I had booked it through their website. I really just wanted to make sure we would be getting what we needed and what he said we would get, which was the Robin Cursoe suite. We had 4 people, which were 4 adults, me and my husband plus our daughter and her friend (so 3 girls and one guy). We needed at least 2 big beds. We were told, plus the pictures on the website, that this suite had a pull out sofa bed downstairs and a king and little hammock upstairs. I thought this was good as the girls could sleep downstairs and we would have the king bed. Well when we got there, no bed downstairs so now there is only 2 beds for 4 adults, not acceptable (one single bed and one king bed upstairs. The air conditioning did not work. this place looked like a dark dungeon inside. You had to leave the door open to see anything on the bottom floor. It looked like it had not been cleaned or used for quite some time. After a little arguing on the beds, they finally brought in another single bed and stuck it in the corner on lower floor. It took quite a while for the 3 workers to get the air working but it was short lived and made a lot of noise. Matias said the air had been working all week and didn't understand why it wasn't working. We found out the next day the other AC's in other rooms hadn't been working either. I ended sleeping downstairs because the girls refused to sleep down there. The musty smell kept me awake most of the night. It was horrible. I was never so glad to leave this hotel. I thought Matias was arrogant and yes, rude at times also. I never felt he was being honest or caring, just wanted the buck. The location is good and the hole in the wall breakfast nook next door had good food. We had room 11 so it was upstairs. The sitting area and balcony area up there was very nice. I haven't seen the upgraded rooms but I think if they put some extra time into these other rooms, it could be a nice little hotel. It's just not right now. The little guy at the desk, I must admit, was very helpful when we needed to try to get a hold of our condo the next day. All in all, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is decent, the manager is not”
Reviews.Author: mamacita11
Reviews.Content: I have visited Playa del Carmen about about 6 times, and stayed at the Hotel Eclipse 3 of those times. My most recent visit was a good one, except for being given the run-around by the office staff, most noticably the manager, and his band of office misfits. I booked a certain room, but arrived late at night and was given a dark hovel, rather than the room I was promised. The next day, I was moved into the actual room I reserved, and the rest of my trip was fine. To its credit, the hotel has recently been renovated and is in decent shape with a super location. The only thing that needs to be removed and improved upon is the office staff. The first problem was the reservation mix-up and the smarmy way it was handled (it was as though he was doing me a big favor). Next, the night before I was leaving, I wanted to sort out my fees; I stood waiting in front of the manager for 5 minutes, growing ever-more angry, while he made moves on some young (female) hotel guests as he sipped on his wine and clutched his guitar in a feeble attempt to look vaguely interesting. I practically had to BEG to find out how much I owed them. Lastly, upon checkout, the clerk in charge was so inept with his calculations of my room rate and hotel shuttle that I was almost charged an extra $2000 pesos! Luckily, I knew what the ballpark total should have been, and so I disputed his total. Others, less experienced with US/MX exchange rates, might have walked out of there almost $200 USD poorer. So, the hotel is fine, the location is great, but the staff leaves a LOT to be desired. Peter, the owner, should SERIOUSLY reconsider the frontman he's chosen for a hotel that could be GREAT...if only...

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: maestranba
Reviews.Content: This would be a gem in the heart of Playa del Carmen if the owner would put a little TLC into it and invest some $$ to fix the rest of the rooms up. We, too, had a mix-up when we arrived. The standard room with a king size bed that we booked directly with the hotel manager wasn't available. I booked it a few months in advance, so I don't know how that happened. We were given a studio instead wih a kitchenette and charged $5 extra per night. I should have argued this with him but I was too tired from traveling and just wanted to go to the beach. The room smelled very musty and the AC didn't work the first two nights. Matias, the manager went out of his way to get it fixed. It was on a Sunday and the repair man wasn't around. Once it was fixed the smell went away. We were in room #1. The bathroom was somewhat updated with a new toilet and sink/faucet, but the shower could use a new shower head, as it flooded the whole bathroom every time we used it. I can see they're working on upgrading the rooms, and some of them are complete and very nice. We loved the location. It's perfect for hanging out downtown, close to everything but away from all the noise. We used the free beach passes to Mamita's a few times, and the best perk was the free breakfast next door at the Hole in the Wall Deli. Their food was excellent and the service was quick and friendly. The maids did a great job cleaning, and again, Matias really went out of his way to remedy our problem with the AC. Pedro and Miguel were also very helpful. We enjoyed sitting on the little patio out front chatting with the guests and people watching. For the price, it's worth it, but I'd be willing to pay a little more to have an upgraded room with newer ammenities, which is what we'll do next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jodyroberts
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here with the same type room (kind of like a two level small bungalow). Price was right for off season and you cannot beat the location off 5th. Service was just ok. Maid service was great. Do not recommend for elderly (either stay on first floor because it can be slippery even with good hiking boots on. I did not make a reservation just a walked in and they honored a discount from the internet rates. Bathrooms were big, water hot. The real only downfall is the room darkness, there is not enough light to read so bring your own book light if you read.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Sbeatz
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant and prompt email exchange with Matias who handled our hotel reservation/questions. Upon arrival, we paid upfront in cash for the Robinson Crusoe suite. For 2 people, the size of the Robinson Cruisoe suite was good however it was dark in the room for the windows upstairs was small plus the bed was super lumpy. I spoke with the staff and was immediately upgraded to the apt (well not really an upgrade since it was the same price) but it was much more spacious and bright. It also included a balcony facing the street which was nice. Pros: ~ Incredibly helpful staff ~ A block away from the amazing beach ~ A block away from 5th ave where all the good shopping and restaurants were ~ Not much noise from parties down the block at night ~ The AC was powerful, a great relief from the heat Cons: ~ Our beds were dirty... I inspected it before sleeping on it and found that the sheets were not changed since I found a couple of long black hairs on the bed and pillows from previous occupants. Gross! There were brown stains on the sheets as well (but we didn't complain to the housekeeping). ~ The blanket on the extra twin size bed was dirty. We didn't touch it so I don't know what was the stuff on the blanket. ~ Some towels also had mysterious brown stains on it ~ The bed was rock hard I did enjoy dealing with the office staff for they were really friendly and had a sense of humor. Just need better housekeeping!! I would most likely fork over more money for better accomodations next time. Helpful tips: Ask about parking regulations!! I didn't know we couldn't park 15meters on a yellow from a corner ( where some yellows you can). The police will give you a ticket AND take your front license plates away. I had to pay Hertz US$133 to recover the license plates and cover the ticket because I didn't have time to do it myself. If you need to check out really early in the morning, make sure you let the office staff know for we had to leave at 7am to catch a flight but didn't realize the office wasn't open until later. We left the key in the room hoping that was okay. Bring shampoo, etc. The only toiletries they provided were bar soaps.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ebobbitt
Reviews.Content: June l, 2007. This hotel is perfect for experiencing Playa Del Carmen. It is close to everything (beach, rest. shopping) without the noise. I stayed in the low season. You can walk everywhere, the bus station is very close, which I used the bus system to go to Tulum and Coba. (the ruins) The owner and staff are very helpful and they make sure your visit is Great.. I felt very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: TaliaLT
Reviews.Content: As a young couple hotel eclipse was a great place for us to call home for a few days. My only real complaint was that there was some confusion over our reservation. Luckily I had printed our confirmation email. Peter, the owner was so great...he immediately upgraded us to an amazing two-story suite for the same price we were quoted for our original room. Other than that it was great. They have a wonderful courtyard with birds and nice landscaping. And the location is absolutely ideal. one block to the beach, one block to the excitement of 5th avenue. The bed was comfortable, maid service was also good. Overall I would recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a quiet place to call home whil exploring playa, (trust me, you wont spend much time in your room anyways). And the price is right...a great value compared to some of the other hotels around. A nice honest little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for us”
Reviews.Author: buffalo52
Reviews.Content: We spent one night on our way down the coast and found the Hotel Eclipse pretty basic but very pleasant. We had a superior standard room on the ground level. Excellent location, easy parking, helpful friendly staff, clean and attractive. It reminded me of several enjoyable two star hotels we have stayed at in Europe. Beds and pillows are a bit on the hard side. We would definitely return for a longer stay other than the fact that Playa del Carmen has become much too touristy and commercial. I really don't need a Starbucks and a MacDonalds around the corner from me when I travel in Mexico but others might think that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Eclipse Hotel a disaster for me!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nng88
Reviews.Content: I checked into the eclipse after extending my stay in PDC. I was not thrilled with the room but thinking it was cheap and the location was good I left my bags in the room and headed to the beach. (i wasn't thrilled with the room because it was very dark, rock hard bed and a kind of rustic decor that really needed an update!) After I returned from the beach the door to my room was wide open! No one was in the room when I entered but soon after a workman came saying he had been working inside and forgot to close the door! OK, not good, but being hot and sandy I was ready to shower and as I stepped in the shower I was shocked to see only a hole in the wall-no showerhead! Now I'm really annoyed, put my sandy wet clothes back on and go to complain. I was told 'theres a problem with the plumbing in that room but you can use the public shower outside" At this point I was in no way going to stay in this dungeon and I requested a refund from Peter/owner. After a heated conversation where he first wanted to refund nothing & then said he could refund 50% of what I paid for the room per policy I realized he was LYING to me as my confirmation stated the refund policy was if room cancelled 3 nights penalty would be charged. At that point when I told him I had it in writing I was refunded my $$ minus 3 nites charge. I really did not appreciate being LIED TO by the owner and could not pack up and get out of Eclipse fast enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!!”
Reviews.Author: FelipeS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to everything but without the noise of many other hotels on 5th Avenue. This hotel is perhpas one of the quietest of the area since it faces 1st Ave instead of 5th Ave. Peter, the owner, is very nice and makes you feel at home at all times. Rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff is really helpful. There is internet access and long distance phone service in the office. Walking distance to the beach, restaurants, bars, etc. Has a nice terrace perfect for relaxing. This very affordable hotel is the perfect place for a relaxing vacation to beautiful Playa del Carmen.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Eclipse
